heisig_story: The suffix "-times" refers to a number of repetitions. Its elements: a mouth . . . pent in. Hint: you may find it more helpful to forget the primitives and think of one circle revovling inside of another.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There's a mouth inside a mouth. But if you look even closer (not actually, but we're pretending), you can see another mouth inside that mouth... and another one inside of that one! It keeps going and going. Can you count the number of times there's a mouth inside a mouth? This kanji also means revolve too. Think of each "time" a thing happens, it loops back around and comes back to the beginning, revolving around again another time.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine yourself counting and counting smaller and smaller mouths inside of each other, recording the number of times you can find a mouth inside another mouth. Dig deeper and deeper until it feels ridiculous how small the mouths are getting. Be sure to focus on the counting and the number of times you find one. Now, how many mouths is this times two, because your mouth is like this too.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If you're having a hard time wrapping your head around the infinite number of times these mouths revolve, just picture yourself in a little kayak („Åã„ÅÑ) going around and down through the mouths.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Your kayak is slashing and dipping through the revolving mouths, going down and down more times than you can count!

humanum_full_description_en:
"Âõû" and "‰∫ò" are a word differentiation. " Hui " in the Shang and Zhou writings resembled a circular and revolving form, and the Warring States characters appeared in two circular forms, which are the origin of the glyphs of later generations. The original meaning of " return " is rotation. "Said Wen": "Return, turn around." Such as "Poetry. Daya. "Yunhan": "Zhuobiyunhan, Zhaohui in the sky." "Mao Zhuan": "Return, turn also." "Xunzi. To the Scholars, "Returning from the Deep Water", Yang Liao's note: "Returning, Flowing Rotation." "Chu Ci. Chapter Nine. "Sorrowful Return to the Wind" "Sorrowful Return to the Wind", Zhu Xi's notes: "Return to the wind, the revolving wind." "Return to the wind" is the whirlwind.

" Hui " means twists and turns, such as "Han Shu. "Zhao Chongguo Xin Qingji Biography": "Wu Xian wants to lightly attract Wanqi, and divides into two paths to go out of Zhangye, and go back thousands of miles." Yan Shigu's note: "Back, it is the song of the road." Western Jin Lu Ji "Answer Zhang Shiran": " Return the canal around the Qumo, and pass the waves to support the straight path." Du Mu of the Tang Dynasty "A Fanggong Fu": "The waist of the corridor is back, the eaves and teeth are high."

" Back " means turning around or turning around, as in "Chu Ci. "Li Sao": "Return to my car to return to the road, and the journey is not far away." Wang Yi's note: "Return, turn." Biography of Fang Shu: "Then Yingchuan's army rises, but he drives back and returns." The extension is return, return. For example, Li Bai "Jiangjinjiu": "You will not see the water of the Yellow River coming from the sky, and rushing to the sea without returning." He Zhizhang "Back to Hometown Puppet Book": "Young and old leave home and the boss returns, but the local accent has not changed. " Back ".

" Hui " means to surround and surround, such as "Han Shu. The Biography of Sima Qian: "It is based on the intestines in one day and nine times. When you live, you will suddenly die, and when you leave, you will not know where you want to go." Biography of Yuan Shao and Liu Biao: "Cao is to chisel the besieged city, and go back forty miles in Zhou Dynasty." Yinqueshan Han Tomb Bamboo Slips "Sun Bin Art of War. "Five Five Honors": "If you come out, you will strike, and if you don't come out, you will return.

" Back " means change, change, such as "Han Shu. "Jia Yi Biography": "Husbands change customs and customs, so that the world will return to the hometown, and it is not what a vulgar official can do." "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "Zhong Hui Biography": "Agriculture is not easy acres, and the city will not return to the market."

" Back " also means rebellion and violation. "poetry. Daya. "Da Ming": "If you don't return to Jue De, you can accept the country." "Mao Zhuan": "Return, violate also." "Book of Rites. "Le Ji": "Advocating harmony and response, returning to evil and straight, each belongs to its own part." Kong Yingda Shu: "Returning is a violation." Northern Song Dynasty Su Shi "Dongpo Zhilin. "Zhao Gao Lisi": "The two of them dare not ask, but also know that the first emperor's bird of prey cannot be returned."

" Back " means evil. "book. "Thai Oath": "Chong believe in evil, let the teacher protect." Kong Anguo Chuan: "Return, evil also." "Mandarin. "Lu Yu": "If the emperor indulges privately and abandons the civil affairs, there will be ambiguities next to the people, and there is no way to save them, and there will be more evils." "Wang Shang Shi Dan Fu Xi Biography": "If you don't follow the law to save the winged country, you will try to gain selfishness by turning back and flattering, and holding the left to chaos the government.

" Back " said reply, reply. Northern Song Dynasty Shen Kuo "Mengxi Bi Tan. Personnel II: "There is a county magistrate that makes people reluctant to go, and they must be reprimanded to reply to the book." Li Yu in the Qing Dynasty, "Naihetian. Forced Marriage: "Why don't you go back to him in person?"

" Hui " is used as a quantifier to indicate the number of times. For example, Li Bai in the Tang Dynasty "Xing Xing": "Peaches and plums have been planted for a few springs, and the flowers will fall and the flowers will be new." It's a few times to hear it." It also means that chapters, like modern chapter-back novels, are divided into chapters.

Radicals: Âè£  (mouth)
Meaning Mnemonic
There's a mouth inside a mouth. But if you look even closer (not actually, but we're pretending), you can see another mouth inside that mouth... and another one inside of that one! It keeps going and going. Can you count the number of times there's a mouth inside a mouth? This kanji also means revolve too. Think of each "time" a thing happens, it loops back around and comes back to the beginning, revolving around again another time.
Imagine yourself counting and counting smaller and smaller mouths inside of each other, recording the number of times you can find a mouth inside another mouth. Dig deeper and deeper until it feels ridiculous how small the mouths are getting. Be sure to focus on the counting and the number of times you find one. Now, how many mouths is this times two, because your mouth is like this too.
Reading Mnemonic
If you're having a hard time wrapping your head around the infinite number of times these mouths revolve, just picture yourself in a little kayak („Åã„ÅÑ) going around and down through the mouths.
Your kayak is slashing and dipping through the revolving mouths, going down and down more times than you can count!
